channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14963] Remove use of Guava Stopwatch from HBase client code
item.description: We ran into an issue where an application bundled its own Guava (and that happened to be in the classpath first) and HBase's MetaTableLocator threw an exception due to the fact that Stopwatch's constructor wasn't compatible... Might be better to not depend on Stopwatch at all in MetaTableLocator since the functionality is easily doable without.
item.summary: Remove use of Guava Stopwatch from HBase client code

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: How about shading (and upgrading) guava? Would that work? Guava has loads of goodies in it but its problematic if bare on our classpath given it evolves so quickly and everyone is stuck on a different incompatible version?
Yes stack that would work for sure. For now, we saw the issue with the Stopwatch class only, and hence the patch to only handle that.. But yeah I agree that shading is a better approach overall.
+1 on this patch in meantime.
isn't this why we have a shaded client already?
Sean Busbey I may have overlooked something. Let me get back (will resolve this issue if this issue has been addressed already)..

Yes, we have a shaded client already, but it is pretty new. Not everybody (for example in this context Phoenix + Storm JDBC) is still using the non-shaded client. I'm +1 to do this as a convenience fix for existing clients.
Thanks Enis Soztutar for the note. Sean Busbey is that good enough justification for committing this patch...

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12776915/no-stopwatch.txt
against master branch at commit 10d86c7daea1f27cb7f9849c907696431cc6ab5c.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12776915

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.6.1 2.7.0 2.7.1)

This message is automatically generated.
sure, fine by me.
Committed this.
Devaraj Das, are you planning to commit this patch to branch-1/branch-1.1 (or branch-1.2 once it is unlocked from release)? I check the code in branch-1, the same problem exists.
we don't remove dependencies in patch releases, so branch-1.1 is out.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-Trunk_matrix #655 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/655/)
HBASE-14963. Remove Guava dependency from HBase client code (ddas: rev 4681827d63be77eae1ee83efa7faf15b9fe214bc)

  • hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/zookeeper/MetaTableLocator.java

Hi, folks

This should go into branch-1 as well.
I have had people complained about the same problem in the version 1x releases. This fix is part of the good effort to clean up compatible use of the StopWatch in Guava. Right?

I just checked the patch again. It does not remove the dependency of guava from the client module as the title suggests. It just changes an internal code path to not use guava, that is all.

I think this can go in all applicable branches.

clean up compatible use of the StopWatch

--> clean up incompatible use of the StopWatch

Right. Enis Soztutar
Let me update the title.
Can you please port it to 1.x as well? We're stuck with this version of guava and it is giving us hard time resolving conflicts with other libraries that depend on newer version.
Ok. If there is no further objection, I will re-open this and commit to the major branch-1.x tomorrow.

The original patch applies cleanly on branch-1.
Attach a new patch to trigger a Hadoop QA on branch-1.

-1 overall

HBASE-14963 Remove use of Guava Stopwatch from HBase client code (jerryjch: rev 8151503fa075bb7388019770bccb28703d23935d)

  • hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/zookeeper/MetaTableLocator.java

Enis Soztutar Jerry He - yeah, belated thanks for committing to 1.3!

As a more general note - I guess we should be moving towards using shaded client when possible. Guava is well known and widely used library with a lot of good things, as stack mentioned, and abstaining from using it for the sake of not causing compatibility issues with client apps is something we should try to avoid.

I am running in to the same issue and i see that it is fixed as part of this issue. How will i be able to get this fix? I am not able to find the 1.4 or 2.0 version of the hbase client on the maven repository. https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.hbase/hbase-client

Gopal Ramakrishnan the 1.3 release line has not yet started producing releases. To get information on how that release line is progressing, I'd recommend searching / joining the dev@hbase mailing list.

In the meantime, you can use the hbase-shaded-client in releases 1.1+.
Thanks Sean Busbey. I did use the shaded client and got around the issue for the time being. I will join the other group to know more about the release.
